etymologies: early 17th century (in the general sense ‘move from one place to another’): from Latin migrat- ‘moved, shifted’, from the verb migrare

definitions: (of an animal, typically a bird or fish) move from one region or habitat to another according to the seasons

examples.text: as autumn arrives, the birds migrate south

shortDefinitions: (of animal) move from one place to another

definitions: (of a person) move to a new area or country in order to find work or better living conditions

examples.text: rural populations have migrated to urban areas

shortDefinitions: move to new place to find work

definitions: move from one part of something to another

examples.text: cells that can form pigment migrate beneath the skin

shortDefinitions: move from one part to another

definitions: change or cause to change from one system to another

examples.text: customers are migrating from mainframes to client-server environments
save time by efficiently migrating data to secondary storage systems

shortDefinitions: change from one system to another

definitions: transfer (programs or hardware) from one system to another

examples.text: the system will allow users to migrate applications across environments

shortDefinitions: transfer programs from one system to another
